context: (Mn+Cu)) was prepared.Catalytic tests Catalytic tests were carried out in a stainless steel reactor (height=60cm, i.d.=2.7cm) at atmospheric pressure and in the temperature range of 150–400°C. The bench test can be found elsewhere. The volume of catalytic fixed bed was 10cm3 and the air flow rate was 50NLh−1 corresponding to a gas hourly space velocity (GHSV) of 5000h−1. Chlorobenzene (CB) was fed to the reactor by means of a saturator at controlled temperature. In order to adjust the CB concentration, two streams of air were employed: one is introduced into a regulated bubble saturator to carry out a constant flow rate of organic vapour, and the other is used to balance the overall concentration. The CB concentration in air was about 500ppm (3000ppm eq. CH4).
